column4: Hello, I'm installing Ubuntu and it doesn't seem to be installing grub properly (doesn't write the mbr). So when the installation program reboots, it boots to my old OS (WinXP) or when the installation CD is still in, it starts the installation again - any clue how to get Ubuntu to properly install GRUB (or write it to the MBR)?
boot from a livecd and try to install it manually i guess... that's all i can think of.
oh yeah, make sure your bios isn't prohibiting writes to the mbr.
I'm having problems installing grub, as I'm not sure how to define my devices and everything in grub-install
I've checked in there, I even tried with "OS Install Mode" :)
sorry, that's all i can think of. i've never encountered grub problems that couldn't be fixed by running grub-install manually. =|
oh, you mean you're not sure whether the drive is hda, hdb, sda, etc?
I know it's sda3, but am not sure how to specify that with grub-install.. It's quite complicated to work with, in my opinion
i see... as far as i remember, it's the drive that should be specified, not the partition, since you're trying to install the mbr. so it should be /dev/sda
ah okay, I'll give that a shot in a minute, thanks :)
good luck! that advice doesn't come with warranties. =D
weird how it couldn't install the mbr though... i've never installed an OS that couldn't write to the mbr.

I tried this an hour ago or so: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/RecoveringUbuntuAfterInstallingWindows#head-a0b7dbaec35668690d12cc1b9a681d218c4ae89b - at point 5 it says "Do not format them", however the Ubuntu installation program tells me it has to format the filesystems needed by ubuntu in order to install the OS. After that there's no "Install Grub" anywhere..
yeah, I was quite confused too - I've been trying around with this for atleast 15 hours now
is that a custom box or not?
i'm just guessing but it might be some weird dell/hp/whatever thingy.
it's a dell, some custom components, but they're all quite standard for a desktop pc
coz i was thinking it might be something weird with their recovery partition and stuff. did you check if the bios prohibits mbr writes?

I've installed quite a few OSes in this system before and never had any problems, I've even enabled "OS Install Mode" in my BIOS.. Couldn't find anything that looks like a read only setting for the MBR :(
well, i'm out of ideas. =(
alright, thanks very much for your help, I'll give it another shot
